column1: Ptosis (eyelid drooping) in infants and children is when the upper eyelid is lower than it should be.
Ptosis in infants and children is often due to a problem with the muscle that raises the eyelid.
A nerve problem in the eyelid can also cause it to droop.
TREATMENT Eyelid lift surgery (blepharoplasty) can repair drooping upper eyelids.
- In severe cases, surgery is needed right away to prevent "lazy eye" (amblyopia).
The provider will also treat any eye problems from ptosis.
Your child may need to: - Wear an eye patch to strengthen vision in the weaker eye.
Children with mild ptosis should have regular eye exams to make sure amblyopia does not develop.
